translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

The government once again reiterates to Your Excellency on the 22nd of the previous month, which was addressed to you in a circular of the same date, and recommends that you most positively order the police commanders of your department to never allow any individual, whoever they may be, to transit within it without being furnished with the proper passport, under the most severe responsibility, which Your Excellency

God keep Your Excellency Caçapava, March 6, 1840 Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães. Serafim Joaquim de Alencastre

Office of the Most Excellent March 6, received on the 20th of the same.

Secretariat of the Republic To citizen Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães, General Commander of Police of the department of Boqueirão. From the Ministry of War. Caçapava

Stamp on
